  <h2 style="color: #404140; font-weight: normal; text-shadow: none;">About Me</h2>
  <p style="color: #404140; margin-top: 20px; font-size: 18px; line-height: 1.6;">
    I'm Yoann Pull, a PhD candidate in Economics at the 
    <a href="https://www.leo-univ-orleans.fr/en/" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;">Laboratoire d'Économie d'Orléans (LEO)</a>, University of Orléans, 
    and a quantitative researcher at Square Management. I am doing my PhD under the supervision of 
    <a href="https://sites.google.com/view/christophe-hurlin/home" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;">Professor Christophe Hurlin</a>. 
    I develop robust econometric and machine-learning methods to measure new and emerging risks in credit risk. 
    I have taught courses at the University of Orléans, the University of Bordeaux, and ENSAI.
  </p>
  <p style="color: #404140; font-size: 18px; line-height: 1.6;">
    On this site you’ll find my research papers and some teaching resources. You can also 
    <a href="CV_Yoann.pdf" target="_blank" style="color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;">download my CV (PDF)</a> 
    and find ways to reach me on the contact page.
  </p>
  <p style="color: #404140; font-size: 18px; line-height: 1.6;">
    <strong>Research interests:</strong> financial econometrics; machine learning; credit risk; alternative data; emerging risks.
  </p>
